page.title: 10Schools in Skegness
page.content: The first of the 5 schools, County Infants, was built in 1908 and the last, Seathorne Primary, was built in 1956. The present Head of the Infant School is Miss Harvey who has been teaching there for 30 years. There are 228 pupils and 9 teachers. The Lumley Secondary School was built in 1931. It was designed in a horseshoe shape but now has added mobiles. Mr Whittaker has been the Head for 3 years. There are 650 pupils and 40 teachers. Mr Webster is the head of Skegness Grammar School, which has 646 pupils and 46 teachers. The school is shaped like a letter "E". Mr Webster has 2 Deputy Heads. There are 12 teachers and 341 pupils at our school, County Junior. It is 50 years old. The Head is called Mr Birks.
